intro: Diplocyclos palmatus subsp. palmatus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of velvety, fleshy leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. The subspecies palmatus is distinguished by its compact growth habit and striking foliage.
